info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.
info.title: Twilio - Serverless

/v1/Services.description: The top-level resource for a Serverless application, which serves as a container for the application environments.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Services.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Service resource. It can be a maximum of 255 characters.

IncludeCredentials.description: Whether to inject Account credentials into a function invocation context. The default value is `true`.

UiEditable.description: Whether the Service's properties and subresources can be edited via the UI. The default value is `false`.

UniqueName.description: A user-defined string that uniquely identifies the Service resource. It can be used as an alternative to the `sid` in the URL path to address the Service resource. This value must be 50 characters or less in length and be unique.

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Assets.description: A wrapper that represents a static file and groups the different Versions of the static file.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Assets.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Asset resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to create the Asset resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Asset resource. It can be a maximum of 255 characters.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Asset Versions.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Asset Version resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Asset resource that is the parent of the Asset Version resources to read.
parameters.name: AssetSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

get.description: Retrieve a specific Asset Version.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Asset Version resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Asset resource that is the parent of the Asset Version resource to fetch.
parameters.name: AssetSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Asset Version resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to delete the Asset resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID that identifies the Asset resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Assets/{Sid}.description: A wrapper that represents a static file and groups the different Versions of the static file.

get.description: Retrieve a specific Asset resource.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Asset resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID that identifies the Asset resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to update the Asset resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID that identifies the Asset resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Asset resource. It can be a maximum of 255 characters.

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Builds.description: A collection of Function Versions, Asset Versions, and Dependencies that form a deployable unit.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Builds.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Build resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Create a new Build resource. At least one function version or asset version is required.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to create the Build resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

AssetVersions.description: The list of Asset Version resource SIDs to include in the Build.

Dependencies.description: A list of objects that describe the Dependencies included in the Build. Each object contains the `name` and `version` of the dependency.

FunctionVersions.description: The list of the Function Version resource SIDs to include in the Build.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to delete the Build resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Build resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Builds/{Sid}.description: A collection of Function Versions, Asset Versions, and Dependencies that form a deployable unit.

get.description: Retrieve a specific Build resource.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Build resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Build resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Builds/{Sid}/S.description: The status of a Build resource.

get.description: Retrieve a specific Build resource.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Build resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Build resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Environments.description: Represents a deployed build of a given set of Functions and/or Assets at a specific URL.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all environments.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Environment resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to create the Environment resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

DomainSuffix.description: A URL-friendly name that represents the environment and forms part of the domain name. It can be a maximum of 16 characters.

UniqueName.description: A user-defined string that uniquely identifies the Environment resource. It can be a maximum of 100 characters.

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Environments/{.description: An association of a Build with an Environment so that the Build is published in the Environment.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Deployments.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Deployment resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment used by the Deployment resources to read.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to create the Deployment resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment for the Deployment.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

BuildSid.description: The SID of the Build for the Deployment.

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Environments/{.description: An association of a Build with an Environment so that the Build is published in the Environment.

get.description: Retrieve a specific Deployment.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Deployment resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment used by the Deployment to fetch.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

parameters.description: The SID that identifies the Deployment resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Environments/{.description: A record of an event that occurred related to a function invocation.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all logs.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Log resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the environment with the Log resources to read.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

parameters.description: The SID of the function whose invocation produced the Log resources to read.
parameters.name: FunctionSid

parameters.description: The date/time (in GMT, ISO 8601) after which the Log resources must have been created. Defaults to 1 day prior to current date/time.
parameters.name: StartDate

parameters.description: The date/time (in GMT, ISO 8601) before which the Log resources must have been created. Defaults to current date/time.
parameters.name: EndDate

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Environments/{.description: A record of an event that occurred related to a function invocation.

get.description: Retrieve a specific log.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Log resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the environment with the Log resource to fetch.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Log resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Environments/{.description: A key and value pair that is specific to an Environment.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Variables.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Variable resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment with the Variable resources to read.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to create the Variable resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment in which the Variable resource exists.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

Key.description: A string by which the Variable resource can be referenced. It can be a maximum of 128 characters.

Value.description: A string that contains the actual value of the Variable. It can be a maximum of 450 bytes in size.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to delete the Variable resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment with the Variables to delete.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Variable resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Environments/{.description: A key and value pair that is specific to an Environment.

get.description: Retrieve a specific Variable.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Variable resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment with the Variable resource to fetch.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Variable resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to update the Variable resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment with the Variable resource to update.
parameters.name: EnvironmentSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Variable resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

Key.description: A string by which the Variable resource can be referenced. It can be a maximum of 128 characters.

Value.description: A string that contains the actual value of the Variable. It can be a maximum of 450 bytes in size.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to delete the Environment resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Environments/{.description: Represents a deployed build of a given set of Functions and/or Assets at a specific URL.

get.description: Retrieve a specific environment.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Environment resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Environment resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Functions.description: A wrapper that represents a Serverless JavaScript function and groups the different  and groups the different Versions of this code.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Functions.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Function resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to create the Function resource under.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Function resource. It can be a maximum of 255 characters.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Function Version resources.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to read the Function Version resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the function that is the parent of the Function Version resources to read.
parameters.name: FunctionSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

get.description: Retrieve a specific Function Version resource.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Function Version resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the function that is the parent of the Function Version resource to fetch.
parameters.name: FunctionSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Function Version resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Functions/{Fun.description: The code of a Function Version.

get.description: Retrieve a the content of a specific Function Version resource.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Function Version content from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Function that is the parent of the Function Version content to fetch.
parameters.name: FunctionSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Function Version content to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to delete the Function resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Function resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{ServiceSid}/Functions/{Sid.description: A wrapper that represents a Serverless JavaScript function and groups the different  and groups the different Versions of this code.

get.description: Retrieve a specific Function resource.

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to fetch the Function resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Function resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Service to update the Function resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the Function resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Function resource. It can be a maximum of 255 characters.

parameters.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the Service resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Services/{Sid}.description: The top-level resource for a Serverless application, which serves as a container for the application environments.

get.description: Retrieve a specific Service resource.

parameters.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the Service resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The `sid` or `unique_name` of the Service resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Service resource. It can be a maximum of 255 characters.

IncludeCredentials.description: Whether to inject Account credentials into a function invocation context.

UiEditable.description: Whether the Service resource's properties and subresources can be edited via the UI. The default value is `false`.

x-maturity.description: PLEASE NOTE that this is a Beta product that is subject to change. Use it with caution.
x-maturity.name: Beta
